title: The body of a teenager found dead near the Murdaugh estate in 2015 will be exhumed
description: Stephen Smith's death was ruled a hit-and-run. His body was found 15 miles from the estate of former South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh, who was found guilty this month of killing his wife and son.

title: Gloria Dea, the 1st magician to perform on the Las Vegas Strip, dies at 100
description: Dea was the first magician to perform on what would become the Las Vegas Strip in the early 1940s. She also appeared in several movies in the 1940s and '50s.

title: A new Arkansas law allows an anti-abortion monument at the state Capitol
description: Arkansas Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders has signed a law to allow a monument near the state Capitol marking the number of abortions performed in Arkansas before Roe v. Wade was overturned.

title: UBS to buy troubled Credit Suisse in deal brokered by Swiss government
description: UBS will buy rival Credit Suisse for more than $2 billion in a deal brokered by Swiss officials to try and prevent a banking crisis.

title: California enters a contract to make its own affordable insulin
description: Under the $50 million deal, the state is partnering with drugmaker Civica to start making the new generic insulin later this year, Gov. Gavin Newsom said.

title: A nuclear power plant leaked contaminated water in Minnesota. Here's what we know
description: The 400,000 gallon leak of water containing tritium occurred in November 2022, but the general public was not notified until last week. Officials said the leak is contained and poses no public danger.

title: Bank fail: How rising interest rates paved the way for Silicon Valley Bank's collapse
description: Silicon Valley Bank invested billions of dollars in super safe U.S. government bonds. But that choice exposed to the bank to a whole other set of risks.

title: How do you take a picture of happiness? We asked photographers to surprise us
description: Monday, March 20 is International Day of Happiness — as proclaimed by the United Nations. The themes this year are gratitude and kindness. We asked photographers to send us images in that vein.

title: South Korea has the world's lowest fertility rate, a struggle with lessons for us all
description: South Korea's government has moved aggressively to encourage more childbirth, but its ongoing struggles point to the complexity of a challenge that is only becoming more salient around the world.

title: 3 takeaways 20 years after the invasion of Iraq
description: Two decades ago, then-President George W. Bush announced the start of combat operations in Iraq. The bloody occupation that followed lasted longer and cost more in lives and money than anyone guessed.

title: Opioids are devastating Cherokee families. The tribe has a $100 million plan to heal
description: The fentanyl crisis is hitting young people hard, and the highest death rates are in Native American communities. The Cherokee Nation is working to help young families recover.

title: Vladimir Putin has made a surprise visit to the occupied city of Mariupol
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has visited the port city of Mariupol, Russian state news agencies reported, in his first trip to Ukrainian territory that Moscow illegally annexed in September.

title: A strong earthquake has killed at least 13 in Ecuador and 1 in Peru
description: The U.S. Geological Survey reported a 6.8 magnitude earthquake centered just off the Pacific Coast, about 50 miles south of Guayaquil, Ecuador's second-largest city.

title: Parliament-Funkadelic singer Clarence 'Fuzzy' Haskins dies at 81
description: The influential vocalist played a key role in shaping the funk and R&B sound of the 1970s.
